p: Parkinsonâ€™s disease (PD) is clinically defined as a movement disorder characterized by motor symptoms related to dopaminergic degeneration of the substantia nigra [ 1]. Non-motor symptoms precede the motor symptoms by years in a majority of cases [ 2]. Different non-motor symptoms such as idiopathic REM sleep behavior disorder (iRBD), hyposmia, depression and constipation, are associated with an increased risk of PD [ 3]. Combined, they can be used to identify probable prodromal PD subjects with over 80% certainty [ 3]. The longest prodromal period, up to 20 years, has been suggested for constipation [ 4].
